Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Duodenum \Du`o*de"num\, n. [NL., fr. duodeni twelve each: cf. F. duodenum. So called because its length is about twelve fingers' breadth.] (Anat.) The part of the small intestines between the stomach and the jejunum. See Illust. of Digestive apparatus, under {Digestive}. [1913 Webster]
duodenum n : the part of the small intestine between the stomach and the jejunum [also: {duonas} (pl), {duona} (pl)]
